lead_paragraph: McNALLY--Virginia Patricia, died peacefully in her sleep at her home just before Christmas. Honored with the award, "A Catholic, a Lady and a Student" upon graduation from her beloved Mary Louis Academy, Virginia lived a long and lovely life. She cherished and enjoyed every moment of her 65 year romance with her husband, William Charles McNally. She is survived by her two daughters Patricia A. Ross married to Stephen M. Ross of Southampton, NY and Johannesburg, South Africa, Nancy E. McNally of Manhattan and Southampton, NY her son William C. McNally Jr. and his wife, Constance of Rancho Santa Fe, CA and her step-grandchild Douglas Benson, his wife Catherine and their three children. Virginia was an avid lover of literature. A true believer in the power of an inquiring and informed mind. A lifelong graceful swimmer. Competitive on the golf course and at the bridge table. Possessed of a sharp sense of humor. And a sensational pair of legs. Which was fortunate given how much time she spent in the arms of her husband on the dance floor. Virginia died the night before what would have been her husband's birthday had he not passed away 10 years earlier. Her family is sure they both decided it was time to celebrate his birthday together again. Virginia will be very much missed by her family and her many, many friends. A memorial service will be held in her honor in the Spring. 1/3
